intro: Sebastiania myrtilloides var. daphnoides, commonly known as the Daphnoides sebastiania, is a species of flowering plant in the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to parts of Central and South America, particularly in regions with tropical climates. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and glossy, dark green leaves. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to several meters. The fruit is a capsule that contains small, hard seeds, which are dispersed by wind or animals.
